intro: Erodium malacoides var. subangulum, commonly known as the coastal bird's-beak, is a flowering plant native to southern California. It is a member of the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, dark brown pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils along coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and drought conditions. This species is often found in coastal scrub and dunes, contributing to the biodiversity of these unique ecosystems.
